page.title: 06CRANLEIGH PARISH CHURCH
page.content: A church has been on this site since late Norman times. The tower possibly dates from about 1170, the nave is Norman with many later additions. The first known priest is Robert de Cumbe, 1283. Since the destruction of most of the stained glass in 1944 by a bomb the inside is full of light. A 12th century carving is said to have inspired the Cheshire cat in 'Alice in Wonderland'. A tomb in the churchyard was reputedly used by smugglers to hide brandy barrels. Four or five services are held every Sunday and the family can attend clubs, Sunday School or Pram Service. {Other places of worship} Cranleigh also has Methodist, Baptist and Evangelical Free Chapels and a branch of Christian Fellowship. There is a large, modern Roman Catholic church.
